speaker: BENEDICK

speaker: BENEDICK

speaker: BENEDICK

speaker: BENEDICK
text: good armor, and now will he lie ten nights awake

speaker: BENEDICK
text: carving the fashion of a new doublet. He was wont

speaker: BENEDICK

speaker: BENEDICK
text: man and a soldier, and now is he turned orthography;

speaker: BENEDICK

speaker: BENEDICK
text: many strange dishes. May I be so converted and see

speaker: BENEDICK
text: with these eyes? I cannot tell; I think not. I will not

speaker: BENEDICK
text: be sworn but love may transform me to an oyster,

speaker: BENEDICK
text: but I’ll take my oath on it, till he have made an

speaker: BENEDICK
text: oyster of me, he shall never make me such a fool.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: One woman is fair, yet I am well; another is wise, yet

speaker: BENEDICK
text: I am well; another virtuous, yet I am well; but till all

speaker: BENEDICK
text: graces be in one woman, one woman shall not

speaker: BENEDICK
text: come in my grace. Rich she shall be, that’s certain;

speaker: BENEDICK
text: wise, or I’ll none; virtuous, or I’ll never cheapen

speaker: BENEDICK
text: her; fair, or I’ll never look on her; mild, or come not

speaker: BENEDICK
text: near me; noble, or not I for an angel; of good

speaker: BENEDICK
text: discourse, an excellent musician, and her hair shall

speaker: BENEDICK
text: be of what color it please God. Ha! The Prince and

speaker: BENEDICK

speaker: PRINCE
text: By my troth, a good song.

speaker: BALTHASAR
text: And an ill singer, my lord.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Ha, no, no, faith, thou sing’st well enough for a

speaker: PRINCE
text: shift.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: An he had been a dog that should

speaker: BENEDICK
text: have howled thus, they would have hanged him. And

speaker: BENEDICK
text: I pray God his bad voice bode no mischief. I had as

speaker: BENEDICK
text: lief have heard the night raven, come what plague

speaker: BENEDICK
text: could have come after it.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Yea, marry, dost thou hear, Balthasar? I pray

speaker: PRINCE
text: thee get us some excellent music, for tomorrow

speaker: PRINCE
text: night we would have it at the Lady Hero’s chamber

speaker: PRINCE
text: window.

speaker: BALTHASAR
text: The best I can, my lord.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Do so. Farewell.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Come hither, Leonato. What was it you told me of

speaker: PRINCE
text: today, that your niece Beatrice was in love with

speaker: PRINCE
text: Signior Benedick?

speaker: CLAUDIO
text:
O, ay.
                 
                Aside
                 
                to
                 
                Prince
                .
               Stalk on, stalk on; the

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: fowl sits.—I did never think that lady would have

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: loved any man.

speaker: LEONATO
text: No, nor I neither, but most wonderful that

speaker: LEONATO
text: she should so dote on Signior Benedick, whom she

speaker: LEONATO
text: hath in all outward behaviors seemed ever to

speaker: LEONATO
text: abhor.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Is ’t possible? Sits the wind in that

speaker: BENEDICK
text: corner?

speaker: LEONATO
text: By my troth, my lord, I cannot tell what to

speaker: LEONATO
text: think of it, but that she loves him with an enraged

speaker: LEONATO
text: affection, it is past the infinite of thought.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Maybe she doth but counterfeit.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Faith, like enough.

speaker: LEONATO
text: O God! Counterfeit? There was never counterfeit

speaker: LEONATO
text: of passion came so near the life of passion as

speaker: LEONATO
text: she discovers it.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Why, what effects of passion shows she?

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Bait the hook well; this fish

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: will bite.

speaker: LEONATO
text: What effects, my lord? She will sit you—you

speaker: LEONATO
text: heard my daughter tell you how.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: She did indeed.

speaker: PRINCE
text: How, how I pray you? You amaze me. I would

speaker: PRINCE
text: have thought her spirit had been invincible against

speaker: PRINCE
text: all assaults of affection.

speaker: LEONATO
text: I would have sworn it had, my lord, especially

speaker: LEONATO
text: against Benedick.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: I should think this a gull but that the

speaker: BENEDICK
text: white-bearded fellow speaks it. Knavery cannot,

speaker: BENEDICK
text: sure, hide himself in such reverence.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: He hath ta’en th’ infection.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Hold it up.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Hath she made her affection known to

speaker: PRINCE
text: Benedick?

speaker: LEONATO
text: No, and swears she never will. That’s her

speaker: LEONATO
text: torment.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: ’Tis true indeed, so your daughter says. “Shall

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: I,” says she, “that have so oft encountered him with

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: scorn, write to him that I love him?”

speaker: LEONATO
text: This says she now when she is beginning to

speaker: LEONATO
text: write to him, for she’ll be up twenty times a night,

speaker: LEONATO
text: and there will she sit in her smock till she have writ

speaker: LEONATO
text: a sheet of paper. My daughter tells us all.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Now you talk of a sheet of paper, I remember

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: a pretty jest your daughter told us of.

speaker: LEONATO
text: O, when she had writ it and was reading it

speaker: LEONATO
text: over, she found “Benedick” and “Beatrice” between

speaker: LEONATO
text: the sheet?

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: That.

speaker: LEONATO
text: O, she tore the letter into a thousand halfpence,

speaker: LEONATO
text: railed at herself that she should be so

speaker: LEONATO
text: immodest to write to one that she knew would flout

speaker: LEONATO
text: her. “I measure him,” says she, “by my own spirit,

speaker: LEONATO
text: for I should flout him if he writ to me, yea, though I

speaker: LEONATO
text: love him, I should.”

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Then down upon her knees she falls, weeps,

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: sobs, beats her heart, tears her hair, prays, curses:

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: “O sweet Benedick, God give me patience!”

speaker: LEONATO
text: She doth indeed, my daughter says so, and

speaker: LEONATO
text: the ecstasy hath so much overborne her that my

speaker: LEONATO
text: daughter is sometimes afeared she will do a desperate

speaker: LEONATO
text: outrage to herself. It is very true.

speaker: PRINCE
text: It were good that Benedick knew of it by some

speaker: PRINCE
text: other, if she will not discover it.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: To what end? He would make but a sport of it

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: and torment the poor lady worse.

speaker: PRINCE
text: An he should, it were an alms to hang him.

speaker: PRINCE
text: She’s an excellent sweet lady, and, out of all suspicion,

speaker: PRINCE
text: she is virtuous.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: And she is exceeding wise.

speaker: PRINCE
text: In everything but in loving Benedick.

speaker: LEONATO
text: O, my lord, wisdom and blood combating in

speaker: LEONATO
text: so tender a body, we have ten proofs to one that

speaker: LEONATO
text: blood hath the victory. I am sorry for her, as I have

speaker: LEONATO
text: just cause, being her uncle and her guardian.

speaker: PRINCE
text: I would she had bestowed this dotage on me. I

speaker: PRINCE
text: would have daffed all other respects and made her

speaker: PRINCE
text: half myself. I pray you tell Benedick of it, and hear

speaker: PRINCE
text: what he will say.

speaker: LEONATO
text: Were it good, think you?

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Hero thinks surely she will die, for she says

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: she will die if he love her not, and she will die ere

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: she make her love known, and she will die if he woo

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: her rather than she will bate one breath of her

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: accustomed crossness.

speaker: PRINCE
text: She doth well. If she should make tender of

speaker: PRINCE
text: her love, ’tis very possible he’ll scorn it, for the man,

speaker: PRINCE
text: as you know all, hath a contemptible spirit.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: He is a very proper man.

speaker: PRINCE
text: He hath indeed a good outward happiness.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Before God, and in my mind, very wise.

speaker: PRINCE
text: He doth indeed show some sparks that are like

speaker: PRINCE
text: wit.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: And I take him to be valiant.

speaker: PRINCE
text: As Hector, I assure you, and in the managing

speaker: PRINCE
text: of quarrels you may say he is wise, for either he

speaker: PRINCE
text: avoids them with great discretion or undertakes

speaker: PRINCE
text: them with a most Christianlike fear.

speaker: LEONATO
text: If he do fear God, he must necessarily keep

speaker: LEONATO
text: peace. If he break the peace, he ought to enter into

speaker: LEONATO
text: a quarrel with fear and trembling.

speaker: PRINCE
text: And so will he do, for the man doth fear God,

speaker: PRINCE
text: howsoever it seems not in him by some large jests

speaker: PRINCE
text: he will make. Well, I am sorry for your niece. Shall

speaker: PRINCE
text: we go seek Benedick and tell him of her love?

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Never tell him, my lord, let her wear it out

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: with good counsel.

speaker: LEONATO
text: Nay, that’s impossible; she may wear her

speaker: LEONATO
text: heart out first.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Well, we will hear further of it by your daughter.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Let it cool the while. I love Benedick well, and I

speaker: PRINCE
text: could wish he would modestly examine himself to

speaker: PRINCE
text: see how much he is unworthy so good a lady.

speaker: LEONATO
text: My lord, will you walk? Dinner is ready.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: If he do not

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: dote on her upon this, I will never trust my

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: expectation.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Let there be the same net

speaker: PRINCE
text: spread for her, and that must your daughter and her

speaker: PRINCE
text: gentlewomen carry. The sport will be when they

speaker: PRINCE
text: hold one an opinion of another’s dotage, and no

speaker: PRINCE
text: such matter. That’s the scene that I would see,

speaker: PRINCE
text: which will be merely a dumb show. Let us send her

speaker: PRINCE
text: to call him in to dinner.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: This can be no trick. The

speaker: BENEDICK
text: conference was sadly borne; they have the truth of

speaker: BENEDICK
text: this from Hero; they seem to pity the lady. It seems

speaker: BENEDICK
text: her affections have their full bent. Love me? Why, it

speaker: BENEDICK
text: must be requited! I hear how I am censured. They

speaker: BENEDICK
text: say I will bear myself proudly if I perceive the love

speaker: BENEDICK
text: come from her. They say, too, that she will rather

speaker: BENEDICK
text: die than give any sign of affection. I did never think

speaker: BENEDICK
text: to marry. I must not seem proud. Happy are they

speaker: BENEDICK
text: that hear their detractions and can put them to

speaker: BENEDICK
text: mending. They say the lady is fair; ’tis a truth, I can

speaker: BENEDICK
text: bear them witness. And virtuous; ’tis so, I cannot

speaker: BENEDICK
text: reprove it. And wise, but for loving me; by my troth,

speaker: BENEDICK
text: it is no addition to her wit, nor no great argument of

speaker: BENEDICK
text: her folly, for I will be horribly in love with her! I

speaker: BENEDICK
text: may chance have some odd quirks and remnants of

speaker: BENEDICK
text: wit broken on me because I have railed so long

speaker: BENEDICK
text: against marriage, but doth not the appetite alter? A

speaker: BENEDICK
text: man loves the meat in his youth that he cannot

speaker: BENEDICK
text: endure in his age. Shall quips and sentences and

speaker: BENEDICK
text: these paper bullets of the brain awe a man from the

speaker: BENEDICK
text: career of his humor? No! The world must be peopled.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: When I said I would die a bachelor, I did not

speaker: BENEDICK
text: think I should live till I were married. Here comes

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Beatrice. By this day, she’s a fair lady. I do spy some

speaker: BENEDICK
text: marks of love in her.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Against my will, I am sent to bid you come

speaker: BEATRICE
text: in to dinner.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Fair Beatrice, I thank you for your pains.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: I took no more pains for those thanks than

speaker: BEATRICE
text: you take pains to thank me. If it had been painful, I

speaker: BEATRICE
text: would not have come.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: You take pleasure then in the message?

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Yea, just so much as you may take upon a

speaker: BEATRICE
text: knife’s point and choke a daw withal. You have no

speaker: BEATRICE
text: stomach, signior. Fare you well.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Ha! “Against my will I am sent to bid you

speaker: BENEDICK
text: come in to dinner.” There’s a double meaning in

speaker: BENEDICK
text: that. “I took no more pains for those thanks than

speaker: BENEDICK
text: you took pains to thank me.” That’s as much as to

speaker: BENEDICK
text: say “Any pains that I take for you is as easy as

speaker: BENEDICK
text: thanks.” If I do not take pity of her, I am a villain; if I

speaker: BENEDICK
text: do not love her, I am a Jew. I will go get her picture.
